message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses the similarities between learning dynamics in deep artificial neural networks and synaptic plasticity in spiking neural networks. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a method for deriving synaptic plasticity rules from task-relevant cost functions and neural dynamics, which is relevant to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also benchmarks its approach on the MNIST and DVS Gestures dataset, indicating relevance to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a brain-inspired computer architecture, which is relevant to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category.
